newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR EXTENDS LOSSES ON KEY UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR EXTENDS LOSSES ON KEY UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was quoted weaker on key currencies in late Friday trade, pressured by continuing importer demand.
But foreign exchange dealers said they expected it to firm in a more stable interbank market next week.

They said they had held a meeting earlier in the day with the central bank which has kept to the sidelines since mid-week as the local unit maintained its slide on the U.S. dollar, sterling and the mark.

"When importers see the dollar depreciate by one percent in one week they want to come in and liquidate their positions and this pressures the rate. There was a bit of panic from importers today but things should stabilise from Monday," one dealer said.
"We had a meeting with the Reserve Bank and clarified a few issues one of them being that the bank believed the market was long but from the dealers' point of view it wasn't," another one added.
At Friday's close, the Zimbabwe dollar was quoted at 10.1000/1300 on the U.S. unit from its 10.0700/1200 late Thursday position.
On the crosses, it was indicated at 15.6980/7510 on sterling from 15.5800/6660, at 6.7890/8120 on the mark versus 6.7380/7730.
It was also easier on the rand at 2.2220/2310 from 2.2050/2180.
